text:
169-163 Bowery, east side, south of Delancey Steet, showing Miner's Bowery Theatre,(165-167) which was known around 1890, as the Royal Theatre.
Also seen is the Third Ave., Elevated Lines.
About 1890.
International News Photos.
The theatre after falling into disrepair was demolished around 1934 and has been replaced by a business structure since. The New York Sun of May 6, 1938, in a list of demolitions reports that the 5-story building (No. 163) adjoining same on the right, is to have its complete
front altered.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - Delancey Street

text:
(1)
Bowery, east side, north from but not including Delancey Street.
The view shows the People's Theatre, 199 Bowery.
May 5, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a closer view of the Theatre Front.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

of Rivington Street.
October 12, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

text:
The Bowery and Environs (midground from right to left) north from Delancey Street (left) as viewed northwestward from the former Libbys Hotel. The photographer is viewing across Rivington to Prince Streets. The Salvation Army Memorial Hotel is on the east side of the Bowery and to the north of Rivington Street.
February 14, 1930.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr
